intro: Hevea cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rubber tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which is harvested for industrial and commercial uses. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and thrives in warm climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
